00022 #include "NicEntryDebug.h"
00023 #include "ChannelAccess.h"
00024 
00025 #include <cassert>

00027 #ifndef nicEV
00028 #define nicEV (ev.isDisabled()||!coreDebug) ? ev : ev << "NicEntry: "
00029 #endif
00030 
00043 void NicEntryDebug::connectTo(NicEntry* other) {
00044   nicEV<<"connecting nic #"<<nicId<< " and #"<<other->nicId<<endl;
00045 
00046   NicEntryDebug* otherNic = (NicEntryDebug*) other;
00047 
00048   cGate *localoutgate = requestOutGate();
00049   localoutgate->connectTo(otherNic->requestInGate());
00050   outConns[other] = localoutgate->getPathStartGate();
00051 }
00052 
00058 void NicEntryDebug::disconnectFrom(NicEntry* other) {
00059   nicEV<<"disconnecting nic #"<<nicId<< " and #"<<other->nicId<<endl;
00060 
00061   NicEntryDebug* otherNic = (NicEntryDebug*) other;
00062 
00063   //search the connection in the outConns list
00064   GateList::iterator p = outConns.find(other);
00065   //no need to check whether entry is valid; is already check by ConnectionManager isConnected
00066   //get the hostGate
00067   //order is phyGate->nicGate->hostGate
00068   cGate* hostGate = p->second->getNextGate()->getNextGate();
00069 
00070   // release local out gate
00071   freeOutGates.push_back(hostGate);
00072 
00073   // release remote in gate
00074   otherNic->freeInGates.push_back(hostGate->getNextGate());
00075 
00076   //reset gates
00077   //hostGate->getNextGate()->connectTo(0);
00078   hostGate->disconnect();
00079 
00080   //delete the connection
00081   outConns.erase(p);
00082 }
00083 
00091 cGate* NicEntryDebug::requestInGate(void) {
00092   // gate of the host
00093   cGate *hostGate;
00094 
00095   if (!freeInGates.empty()) {
00096     hostGate = freeInGates.back();
00097     freeInGates.pop_back();
00098   } else {
00099     char gateName[20];
00100 
00101     // we will have one more in gate
00102     ++inCnt;
00103 
00104     //get a unique name for the gate (composed of the nic module id and a counter)
00105     sprintf(gateName, "in%d-%d", nicId, inCnt);
00106 
00107     // create a new gate for the host module
00108     nicPtr->getParentModule()->addGate(gateName, cGate::INPUT);
00109     hostGate = nicPtr->getParentModule()->gate(gateName);
00110 
00111     // gate of the nic
00112     cGate *nicGate;
00113 
00114     // create a new gate for the nic module
00115     nicPtr->addGate(gateName, cGate::INPUT);
00116     nicGate = nicPtr->gate(gateName);
00117 
00118     // connect the hist gate with the nic gate
00119     hostGate->connectTo(nicGate);
00120 
00121     // pointer to the phy module
00122     ChannelAccess* phyModule;
00123     // gate of the phy module
00124     cGate *phyGate;
00125 
00126     // to avoid unnecessary dynamic_casting we check for a "phy"-named submodule first
00127     if ((phyModule = static_cast<ChannelAccess *> (nicPtr->getSubmodule("phy"))) == NULL)
00128       phyModule = FindModule<ChannelAccess*>::findSubModule(nicPtr);
00129 
00130     // create a new gate for the phy module
00131     phyModule->addGate(gateName, cGate::INPUT);
00132     phyGate = phyModule->gate(gateName);
00133 
00134     // connect the nic gate (the gate of the compound module) to
00135     // a "real" gate -- the gate of the phy module
00136     nicGate->connectTo(phyGate);
00137   }
00138 
00139   return hostGate;
00140 }
00141 
00146 cGate* NicEntryDebug::requestOutGate(void) {
00147   // gate of the host
00148   cGate *hostGate;
00149 
00150   if (!freeOutGates.empty()) {
00151     hostGate = freeOutGates.back();
00152     freeOutGates.pop_back();
00153   } else {
00154     char gateName[20];
00155 
00156     // we will have one more out gate
00157     ++outCnt;
00158 
00159     //get a unique name for the gate (composed of the nic module id and a counter)
00160     sprintf(gateName, "out%d-%d", nicId, outCnt);
00161 
00162     // create a new gate for the host module
00163     nicPtr->getParentModule()->addGate(gateName, cGate::OUTPUT);
00164     hostGate = nicPtr->getParentModule()->gate(gateName);
00165 
00166     // gate of the nic
00167     cGate *nicGate;
00168     // create a new gate for the nic module
00169     nicPtr->addGate(gateName, cGate::OUTPUT);
00170     nicGate = nicPtr->gate(gateName);
00171 
00172     // connect the hist gate with the nic gate
00173     nicGate->connectTo(hostGate);
00174 
00175     // pointer to the phy module
00176     ChannelAccess* phyModule;
00177     // gate of the phy module
00178     cGate *phyGate;
00179 
00180     // to avoid unnecessary dynamic_casting we check for a "phy"-named submodule first
00181     if ((phyModule = static_cast<ChannelAccess *> (nicPtr->getSubmodule("phy"))) == NULL)
00182       phyModule = FindModule<ChannelAccess*>::findSubModule(nicPtr);
00183     assert(phyModule != 0);
00184 
00185     // create a new gate for the phy module
00186     phyModule->addGate(gateName, cGate::OUTPUT);
00187     phyGate = phyModule->gate(gateName);
00188 
00189     // connect the nic gate (the gate of the compound module) to
00190     // a "real" gate -- the gate of the phy module
00191     phyGate->connectTo(nicGate);
00192   }
00193 
00194   return hostGate;
00195 }
